intro: Hieracium lachenalii subsp. rudicaule, commonly known as the rough hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its rough, hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides. Its subspecies status reflects subtle morphological differences from the main species, particularly in leaf and stem structure.
